code: @Manual{,   title = {gglogger: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls},   author = {Panwen Wang},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://github.com/pwwang/gglogger/}, }

what: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
text: gglogger R package logs calls used create ggplot2 objects. can useful debugging, reproducibility, understanding sequence operations used build plot. ever created plot ggplot2 forgotten made ? wanted reproduce plot couldn’t remember exact sequence operations used? gglogger can help!

title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
text: can install gglogger package source using devtools:

title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
text: use gglogger package, simply load along ggplot2 create plots usual. package automatically log calls used create plots. Evaluate code logs reproduce plot: can also attach variables environment evaluation:
code: library(ggplot2)  p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +     geom_point() library(ggplot2) # Just add gglogger after ggplot2 library(gglogger)  p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) +     geom_point()  # Print the logs print(p$logs) ## ggplot2::ggplot(mpg, aes(x = displ, y = hwy)) + ##   geom_point() p$logs$evaluate() env <- new.env() env$mpg <- mpg env$mpg$hwy <- mpg$hwy / 2 p$logs$evaluate(env)

what: Registering a function from a ggplot2 extension
title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
code: library(dplyr) library(gglogger)  mtcars_radar <- mtcars %>%   as_tibble(rownames = "group") %>%   mutate_at(vars(-group), scales::rescale) %>%   tail(4) %>%   select(1:10)  ggradar <- register(ggradar::ggradar)  p <- ggradar(mtcars_radar, legend.position = "right") print(p$logs)  # ggradar::ggradar(mtcars_radar, legend.position = "right")

what: Generating code to reproduce a plot
title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
code: # p is a ggradar plot created in the previous example  code <- p$logs$gen_code(setup = ' library(dplyr) library(ggradar)  mtcars_radar <- mtcars %>%   as_tibble(rownames = "group") %>%   mutate_at(vars(-group), scales::rescale) %>%   tail(4) %>%   select(1:10) ')  cat(code) ## library(dplyr) ## library(ggradar) ## ## mtcars_radar <- mtcars %>% ##   as_tibble(rownames = "group") %>% ##   mutate_at(vars(-group), scales::rescale) %>% ##   tail(4) %>% ##   select(1:10) ## ## ## ggradar::ggradar(mtcars_radar, legend.position = "right")  # eval(parse(text = code)) # to reproduce the plot

title: A Package to Log ggplot2 Calls
text: gglogger log global settings used create plot, theme_set(). can log calls used directly create plot . may need manually set global settings reproducing plot, prepare using setup argument gen_code().

title: GGLog class — GGLog-class
text: `GGLog` class used store single ggplot call.

title: GGLog class — GGLog-class
text: code string store code ggplot call.

title: GGLog class — GGLog-class
text: evaluate(envir = parent.frame()) Evaluate log. @param envir environment evaluate log . stringify() Stringify log. @return string.

title: GGLogs class — GGLogs-class
text: `GGLogs` class used store logs ggplot calls.   log stored `GGLog` object.   object can accessed using `$logs` field ggplot object.

title: GGLogs class — GGLogs-class
text: logs list store logs.

title: GGLogs class — GGLogs-class
text: add(log) Add log list. @param log GGLog object. evaluate(envir = parent.frame()) Evaluate logs list. @param envir environment evaluate logs . gen_code(setup = "library(ggplot2)") Generate code logs list. @param setup string setup environment. @return string code. stringify() Stringify logs list. @return string.
